DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the color of an individual's eyes.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having substance or material existence; concerned with material things; of or pertaining to the body as distinguished from the mind or spirit._Characteristics; distinguishing qualities of a person, object, or substance._The organ of sight or vision._The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having substance or material existence; concerned with material things; of or pertaining to the body as distinguished from the mind or spirit.:The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Concepts.definition: Having substance or material existence; concerned with material things; of or pertaining to the body as distinguished from the mind or spirit.
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Property.preferredDefinition: The organ of sight or vision.:The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation.

Concepts.definition: The organ of sight or vision.
The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Uveal Melanoma form per request by T.Lichtenberg. mc 8/29/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An achromatic color of any lightness between the extremes of black and white.

Concepts.definition: An achromatic color of any lightness between the extremes of black and white.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hue of the long-wave end of the visible spectrum, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 630 to 750 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue resembles that of blood: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A bluish-purple color.

Concepts.definition: The hue of the long-wave end of the visible spectrum, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 630 to 750 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue resembles that of blood
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A color that consists of brown-gold and green.

Concepts.definition: A color that consists of brown-gold and green.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between green and indigo, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 420 to 490 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation, whose hue is that of a clear daytime sky.

Concepts.definition: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between green and indigo, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 420 to 490 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation, whose hue is that of a clear daytime sky.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue is that of the emerald or somewhat less yellow than that of growing grass.

Concepts.definition: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue is that of the emerald or somewhat less yellow than that of growing grass.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of a group of colors between red and yellow in hue that are medium to low in lightness and low to moderate in saturation.

Concepts.definition: Any of a group of colors between red and yellow in hue that are medium to low in lightness and low to moderate in saturation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation.:The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
